business.headline: Can you get a personal loan with low credit score? Check detailsWhile a low credit score may present challenges, using strategies like reduced DTI, and showing income stability, etc. can help secure a personal loan and improve your credit for the future.
Tata Consumer dismisses reports of Starbucks exiting India as baselessAn earlier report claimed that Starbucks was considering exiting the Indian market due to high costs and mounting losses.
Sensex ends nearly 1,000 points lower, Nifty below 24,000The Sensex ended 964.15 points lower at 79,218.05, while the Nifty50 settled 247.15 points lower at 23,951.70.

Missed ITR deadline? Here's your guide to filing belated return for AY 2024-25The last date to file a belated or revised ITR for FY 2023-24 is December 31, 2024—ensure all dues and penalties are paid to avoid additional charges.

Quick delivery, quicker success: Zepto founders top Hurun listZepto, established in 2021 by the duo of Kaivalya Vohra and Aadit Palicha, has revolutionised the quick-commerce sector with its 10-minute grocery delivery model.

US Fed rate cut decision: How will it impact Indian stock markets? The Sensex declined over 1,100 points and the Nifty fell below 24,000 after the US Federal Reserve's decision to cut interest rates by 0.25% to 4.5%, coupled with a hawkish outlook on future rate adjustments.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Latest GMP sees sharp rise; should you subscribe?Mamata Machinery, a leading manufacturer of packaging machines, seeks to raise Rs 179.39 crore from its offer for sale, with promoters selling up to 73.82 lakh equity shares at a face value of Rs 10 each.
Explained: Why SpiceJet share price jumped nearly 8% todaySpicejet share price: The airline's share price was up 7.48% to Rs 60.49 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 12:40 pm.

PMAY-U 2.0: Who can apply for affordable homes under Pradhan Mantri Awas YojanaPradhan Mantri Awas Yojana Urban 2.0 aims to provide affordable housing to one crore urban families, focusing on inclusive development through various housing schemes and subsidies.

Explained: Why Sensex fell over 1,000 points today and will bloodbath continue? Sensex and Nifty extended their losing streak as global markets plunged after the US Fed's cautious rate cut signal. Will the bears tighten their grip on Dalal Street, or is a reversal in sight?

Sanathan Textiles IPO opens for bidding: Check issue size, price band, latest GMPSanathan Textiles' Rs 550 crore IPO offers investment opportunities in a leading yarn manufacturer, with proceeds directed towards debt repayment and growth initiatives.

Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO share listing: Stocks list at 43% premium Inventurus Knowledge Solutions IPO share price: On the NSE, the shares opened at Rs 1,900 per share, marking a premium of 42.96% over the issue price.
Rupee plunges to all-time low, reaches Rs 85 against US dollar Rupee falls to all-time low: The rupee dropped to 85.0650 against the US dollar in early trade, compared to 84.9525 on Wednesday.

Dalal Street bloodbath: 3 reasons behind today's stock market crashStock market crash: Sensex dropped over 1,000 points while Nifty fell below 24,000, marking the fourth consecutive day of losses for the benchmark indices.

Wall Street jitters: Sensex crashes, Nifty tumbles over US Fed rate cutStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 925.21 points to 79,256.69, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 309.75 points to 23,889.10.

Transrail Lighting IPO: All you need to know. Check GMP before subscribing Transrail Lighting Limited, established in February 2008, is an engineering and construction company specialising in power transmission and distribution.

US Fed cuts key interest rates by 0.25%: 3 key takeaways for stock marketsThe Fed's decision, along with its forecast of fewer rate cuts in 2025, rattled investors across the globe, leading to widespread sell-offs in equities.
Will 2025 bring a bull run? Key trends for Nifty to watchICICI Securities projects a 20% rise in Nifty for 2025, driven by historical trends, sectoral strength, and strategic stock picks.
Rama Mohan Rao Amara appointed as SBI's new managing director: ReportThe decision was made by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC), which is headed by the Prime Minister.

Own foreign assets or income? Disclose now to avoid Rs 10 lakh penaltyTaxpayers must disclose foreign income and assets by December 31, 2024, to avoid hefty penalties under the Income Tax and Black Money Acts.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Complaint vs complaint: BJP, Congress knock cops' doors as 'assault' row snowballsUnion Minister Anurag Thakur, leading a delegation of BJP MPs, lodged a complaint with the Delhi Police against Rahul Gandhi, alleging assault and incitement. Meanwhile, a delegation of Congress MPs filed a counter-complaint at the Parliament Street Police Station.

BJP says Rahul Gandhi 'behaved like a goon', Congress alleges his entry blockedParliament Winter Session Live Updates: Both houses of Parliament, Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha, were adjourned for the day after uproar by India bloc MPs minutes after they reconvened at 2 pm. Earlier, tensions erupted outside Parliament on Thursday as BJP and Congress MPs traded accusations of assault during protests over Amit Shah's remarks on Dr BR Ambedkar. Both sides alleged physical confrontations. The chaos began with BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi claiming that Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP, who eventually fell on him, causing him injuries. Follow India Today for the latest updates.

Drawn to mar reputation: Opposition's no-trust motion against V-P rejectedIn a detailed order, Deputy Chairman Harivansh called the motion "flawed", adding that it was drawn in "haste" to mar the reputation of the Chairman.

India-Pakistan matches until 2028 at neutral venues, including Champions TrophyThe International Cricket Council (ICC) announced that the 2025 Champions Trophy will be held using a hybrid model, which means India will play its matches at a neutral venue. In return, Pakistan's matches in ICC events hosted by India will also take place at a neutral venue.

Women are flowers, says Iran's Khamenei, Israel replies with a photo. But whose?Israel has a response to Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, who described women as "a delicate flower". The response features a photo of a woman dressed in all black with her head covered. Here's who she is and why Israel used her photo.

Sunita Williams will not return from space in Feb 2025. Nasa announces new dateTechnical complications, including thruster malfunctions and helium leaks, forced Nasa to return the Starliner uncrewed in September, leaving astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore stranded on the ISS.

Omar Abdullah defends Rahul Gandhi amid Parliament row: He will never push anyoneSpeaking outside Parliament, Omar Abdullah dismissed the allegations, asserting that such behaviour was entirely inconsistent with Rahul Gandhi's character.

New US visa appointment rules to cut wait time, bring relief for Indians in 2025The US Embassy in India has announced new regulations to reduce wait time and streamline the non-immigrant visa appointment process, starting January 1, 2025. Applicants can also reschedule their appointments once without paying additional fees. This comes amid the recent announcement of the H-1B visa system overhaul.

Reel gets Real: Pushpa Allu Arjun's stand-off with Hyderabad police goes from bad to worseApart from the political support Allu Arjun received from the BJP and the BRS, the impression that gained ground was that the actor was trying to project himself as a victim, by virtue of having spent time in jail.

Did Assad give Syria's military secrets to Israel to save himself, family?Former Syrian President Bashar al-Assad exchanged his country's military secrets with Israel for a safe passage out of the country, according to Turkish media reports. As rebel forces moved into Damascus, Assad is said to have given the coordinates of weapon depots to Israel, which then bombed them.

Nitin Gadkari on live-in relationships: Violate norms, will destroy societyUnion Minister Nitin Gadkari criticised live-in relationships and same-sex marriages as violations of societal norms, warning they could collapse the social structure.

French man jailed for 20 years for drugging wife, recruiting 50 men to rape herA French court has convicted Dominique Pelicot of drugging and orchestrating the rape of his wife, Gisele Pelicot, over nearly a decade. The case has sparked national outrage and calls for stronger consent laws.

Alia Bhatt's subtle reply to trolls, likes post appreciating Ranbir KapoorAlia Bhatt subtly defended her husband Ranbir Kapoor against online trolls by liking a positive post about him. The incident occurred after a video from the Raj Kapoor Film Festival went viral, highlighting Ranbir's actions in contrast to Saif Ali Khan's.

'Felt uncomfortable': Woman BJP MP says Rahul Gandhi stood close, shouted at herA woman MP alleged that Rahul Gandhi misbehaved with her at Parliament during the protest and claimed the Congress leader's behaviour and close physical proximity made her feel extremely uncomfortable.

Mysterious 'Dinga Dinga' virus in Uganda causes uncontrollable shakingA mysterious illness known as "Dinga Dinga" has struck Uganda's Bundibugyo district, mostly affecting women and girls. It causes uncontrollable shaking, and in severe cases, paralysis.

Knees injured: Mallikarjun Kharge claims BJP MPs pushed him during protestCongress Chief Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that BJP MPs pushed him, causing a knee injury, and termed it an attack on his roles as Congress President and Leader of the Opposition in Rajya Sabha, seeking an enquiry.
Kia Syros bookings, all details through imagesKia Syros bookings will open on January 3, while customer deliveries will start in early February.

Post-Syria, why Uyghur militant group's threat to China is India's worry tooA South Asia spillover of the Turkistan Islamic Party's planned offensive against China has grave implications for regional stability and Indian counterterrorism efforts

Mufasa The Lion King review: Visually stunning but a forgettable prequelMufasa: The Lion King movie review: Directed by Barry Jenkins, Mufasa: The Lion King is a prequel to the 1994-film The Lion King. The prequel lacks emotional gravtias.

BJP's fresh charge against Rahul a conspiracy to save Amit Shah: Priyanka GandhiCongress MP Priyanka Gandhi accuses the BJP of "hooliganism" and conspiracy after LoP in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi is accused of pushing a BJP MP. The opposition demands Amit Shah's resignation, intensifying the standoff in Parliament over Ambedkar-related remarks.

Ola CEO's 'stern warning' mail to employees on misuse of work from home goes viralA screenshot of an email reportedly sent by Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal to his employees on the 'misuse' of work from home has gone viral on social media.

Ashwin was humiliated: Father Ravichandran says retirement 'shocked' familyR Ashwin's father said the timing of the off-spinner's retirement from international cricket came as a surprise to the family. Ravichandran added that he had hoped his son would continue playing for the senior national team.

India is losing Bangladesh to China and Pakistan—And It could get worseHow Bangladesh's shift to China and Pakistan challenges India's influence and disrupts South Asia's fragile geopolitical balance.

Director Sukumar visits child injured in Pushpa 2 stampede, donates Rs 5 lakhDirector Sukumar visited Sri Tej, a nine-year-old child, who was critically injured in the Pushpa 2 stampede. Earlier, he and his wife donated Rs 5 lakh to the affected family.

Actor Suriya credits director Bala for shaping his career: Thank you for discovering me Actor Suriya expressed heartfelt gratitude to director Bala for shaping his career, crediting him with pivotal breakthroughs that led to key roles in Tamil cinema.
Kajol shines bright in yellow: Twinning with the sunsetKajol treated her fans to stunning photos from her recent flight, where she radiated charm and elegance in a vibrant yellow suit set.

Varun Dhawan recreates real-life wedding moment with Keerthy in Baby John songVarun Dhawan recreated a memorable wedding moment with Keerthy Suresh in the song Hazaar Baar from his upcoming film Baby John, capturing the essence of romance akin to his real-life wedding.

Vicky Jain's birthday wish for Ankita Lokhande: Best thing about us is clarityVicky Jain extended his birthday wishes to wife Ankita Lokhande with a sweet post. He thanked the actor for always being by his side.

sports.headline: Explained: What the new India-Pakistan ICC agreement means for world cricketThe International Cricket Council brokered an agreement between India and Pakistan that they will not have to play at each other's home venues in any ICC tournaments till 2028. While the decision worked out well for both countries, here's how it affects the rest of the cricketing world.

Monaco's Singo apologies to Donnarumma after PSG confirm gruesome facial injuryMonaco defender Wilfried Singo has apologised for his dangerous move that left PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma with multiple cuts and facial trauma during a French league game.

Ashwin was not treated fairly, his sudden retirement a shock: Ex-CSK teammateOff-spinner R Ashwin shocked quite a few by announcing his international retirement midway through the crucial Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Ashwin left Australia and reached Chennai as early as Thursday.

MCA launches new logo for Wankhede's 50-year celebrationThe Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) unveiled its plan for the 50th anniversary of the Wankhede Stadium with the event taking place on January 19. Fans can buy tickets online for a nominal fee.

Australia lucky to have Scott Boland as Hazlewood's replacement: Brett LeeAustralia are lucky to have Scott Boland to replace Josh Hazlewood, said Brett Lee. Hazlewood is unlikely to play any further part in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy due to a calf injury.

Unsold in IPL auction, Afghanistan's Sediqullah hits maiden ODI hundred ZIM vs AFG: Sediqullah Atal scored 104 runs off 128 balls against Zimbabwe in the second game of the three-match ODI series at the Harare Sports Club. Atal had gone unsold in the IPL 2025 auction in Jeddah.

United boss Ruben Amorim on Marcus Rashford situation: I will handle itManchester United manager Ruben Amorim addressed the growing uncertainty around Marcus Rashford's future at the club, emphasising his commitment to handling the situation internally. Rashford's struggles and omission from key matches have fuelled speculation about his potential departure.

India-Pakistan matches until 2028 at neutral venues, including Champions TrophyThe International Cricket Council (ICC) announced that the 2025 Champions Trophy will be held using a hybrid model, which means India will play its matches at a neutral venue. In return, Pakistan's matches in ICC events hosted by India will also take place at a neutral venue.

Shaheen signs for BPL 2024 after being 'rested' for South Africa Tests After being rested for the Test series against South Africa, Pakistan left-arm fast bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi is set to play for Fortune Barishal in the Bangladesh Premier League 2024.

Wouldn't have let R Ashwin retire like this, he deserves respect: Kapil DevFormer Indian cricket captain Kapil Dev has expressed disappointment over how veteran off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket.

Unsold in IPL auction, Afghanistan's Sediqullah hits maiden ODI hundred ZIM vs AFG: Sediqullah Atal scored 104 runs off 128 balls against Zimbabwe in the second game of the three-match ODI series at the Harare Sports Club. Atal had gone unsold in the IPL 2025 auction in Jeddah.

Rashford's struggles and omission from key matches have fuelled speculation about his potential departure.

In return, Pakistan's matches in ICC events hosted by India will also take place at a neutral venue.

Shaheen signs for BPL 2024 after being 'rested' for South Africa Tests After being rested for the Test series against South Africa, Pakistan left-arm fast bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi is set to play for Fortune Barishal in the Bangladesh Premier League 2024.

Wouldn't have let R Ashwin retire like this, he deserves respect: Kapil DevFormer Indian cricket captain Kapil Dev has expressed disappointment over how veteran off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from international cricket.

Ashwin was humiliated: Father Ravichandran says retirement 'shocked' familyR Ashwin's father said the timing of the off-spinner's retirement from international cricket came as a surprise to the family. Ravichandran added that he had hoped his son would continue playing for the senior national team.

South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj ruled out of last two Pakistan ODIsSouth Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj will miss the last two ODIs against Pakistan at home. Maharaj suffered an injury while warming up for the first ODI.

Not easy for Siraj to support world-class Jasprit Bumrah: Brett LeeJasprit Bumrah's exceptional bowling in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy left Australia reeling, overshadowing his teammates despite their efforts. Former Australian pacer Brett Lee praised Bumrah's brilliance, highlighting the immense challenge for others to match his extraordinary standards.

Josh Hazlewood frustrated by injury setback, hopes to be fit for Sri Lanka tourAustralia pacer Josh Hazlewood revealed that the injury he sustained midway through the third Test in Brisbane had left him 'frustrated'. The injury's unlucky timing brought an early end to his 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy campaign.

Virat Kohli confronts Aussie journalist for photographing family at airportBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Batting star Virat Kohli had a heated argument with a reporter at the Melbourne airport. Kohli did not like the journalist clicking photos of his wife, Anushka Sharma, and their children.

Anna for a reason: Jadeja pays tribute to Ashwin after spin twin retiresBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Ravindra Jadeja came up with an emotional tribute to his spin-bowling partner R Ashwin, a day after the veteran retired from international cricket.

R Ashwin's daughter welcomes retired star with heartwarming posterRavichandran Ashwin's daughter welcomed the retired spinner with a heartwarming poster that read, "Thank you, Ashna. You have the streets." Ashwin returned to Chennai a day after announcing his retirement in Brisbane.

Josh Hazlewood frustrated by injury setback, hopes to be fit for Sri Lanka tourAustralia pacer Josh Hazlewood revealed that the injury he sustained midway through the third Test in Brisbane had left him 'frustrated'. The injury's unlucky timing brought an early end to his 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy campaign.

Young chess champion D Gukesh opens up about his journey to the topYoung chess star D Gukesh reveals his emotional journey to becoming the world's best player.

Emotional father kisses Ashwin during hero's welcome at Chennai residenceRavichandran Ashwin returned to a hero's welcome in Chennai after retiring from international cricket, with fans, family, and his father celebrating his illustrious career. Ashwin reflected on his journey and reaffirmed his plans to continue playing in the IPL.

I have zero regrets, want to play for CSK as long as possible: R AshwinR Ashwin returned to Chennai on Thursday, a day after announcing his retirement in Brisbane. Ashwin addressed the media after receving a hero's welcome at his residence.

D Gukesh reflects on his journey as youngest chess championD Gukesh shares his journey as the youngest chess world champion, discussing his emotions, prize money, and responses to criticism from chess legends.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
